required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Pain Neurophysiology Education in Combination With Motor Control Training for Unspecific Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Pain Neurophysiology Education in Combination With Motor Control Training for Patients With Unspecific Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the present study is to evaluate whether the addition of two pain neurophysiology education sessions to motor control training may result in an improvement of the outcome measures of pain and disability, compared to motor control training alone.

detailed_description.textblock: Sixty-two subjects with unspecific low-back pain were randomly recruited for the present study. The subjects were randomly allocated to a control group (which received only motor control training) and an intervention group (which underwent two pain neurophysiology education sessions prior to motor control training). Primary outcome measures were pain (measured with the Visual Analogical Scale) and disability (measured with the Oswestry Disability Index). Secondary outcome measures are kinesiophobia (Tampa Scale for Kinesiophobia), the global perceived effect (Global Perceived Effect Scale) and quality of life (SF-12). These will be measured before the intervention, at the end of the intervention and 3 months after ending the intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in pain at different time points
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed before the intervention, at the end of the 4-week motor control intervention and 3 months after the end of the intervention

primary_outcome.measure: Change in disability at different time points
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed before the intervention, at the end of the 4-week motor control intervention and 3 months after the end of the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in kinesiophobia at different time points
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed before the intervention, at the end of the 4-week intervention and 3 months after the end of the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Global Perceived Effect at different time points
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed before the intervention, at the end of the 4-week motor control intervention and 3 months after the end of the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life at different time points
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed before the intervention, at the end of the 4-week motor control intervention and 3 months after the end of the intervention

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain Neurophysiology Education and motor control training
arm_group.description: This group will undergo two pain neurophysiology education sessions prior to motor control training.
This group will only perform motor control training.

intervention.description: Exercises to strengthen the lumbar musculature and control the posture.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pain Neurophysiology Education and motor control training

intervention.description: Educational sessions to improve patient's neurophysiology of pain knowledge.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pain Neurophysiology Education and motor control training

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unspecific low back pain for at least 3 months
- Patients must be knowledgeable in the language in which the educational sessions will be provided (Spanish)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Specific low back pain (e.g. infection, tumor, fracture, radiculopathy).
- Signs and symptoms of neuropathic pain or generalized chronic pain.
- History of lumbar or cervical spine surgery.
- Pregnancy.
- Concomitant pathologies that impede the performance of exercises.
- Psychiatric treatment.
